items.title: Who is he?
items.comment: A question asking for someone's identity. '谁' (shéi) means 'who'.

items.title: He is my classmate.
items.comment: A simple statement introducing someone as a classmate.

items.title: What about him? Are you studying with him?
items.pinyin: tā ne? nǐ tóng tā shì xué ma?
items.pronounce: tah nuh? nee tong tah shrr shweh ma?
items.comment: The particle '呢' (ne) is used to ask 'what about' someone. '学' (xué) means 'study'.

items.text: 他不是我同学。他是我朋友。
items.title: He is not my classmate. He is my friend.
items.pinyin: tā bù shì wǒ tóngxué. tā shì wǒ péngyǒu.
items.pronounce: tah boo shrr waw tong-shweh. tah shrr waw pung-yo.
items.comment: A negative statement using '不是' (bù shì) to deny something. '朋友' (péngyǒu) means 'friend', introducing a different relationship.

items.title: Classmate
items.comment: '同学' (tóngxué) refers to a classmate, someone who studies in the same school or class.

items.title: What about...?
items.comment: The particle '呢' (ne) is used to turn a statement into a follow-up question, often meaning 'what about...?'

items.title: To study
items.comment: '是学' (shì xué) is not a common phrase. If intended as 'studying,' the correct word is '学习' (xuéxí).

items.title: Friend
items.comment: '朋友' (péngyǒu) means 'friend' and is commonly used to refer to close acquaintances.

items.title: You and...
items.comment: '你同' (nǐ tóng) is not a common phrase in Mandarin. A more natural expression for 'you and' would be '你和' (nǐ hé).

items.title: Elementary school
items.comment: '小学' (xiǎoxué) refers to elementary or primary school, typically covering early education years.

items.title: Middle school / High school
items.comment: '中学' (zhōngxué) refers to middle school and high school education. '中' (zhōng) means 'middle' or 'central'.

items.title: University / College
items.comment: '大学' (dàxué) means university or college, referring to higher education institutions.
